On this note, I give the app 5 stars, HOWEVER, it does not work over the wifi networks in large hotels with complicated router systems and security checks.  The Airplay app on your phone or iPad will not be able to find your Amazon Fire device, even if they are connected to the same network name.

author: Stuart Berwick
title: A must have App for any Fire TV user. Simple setup and use and watching video on my iPhone being shown on my TV is terrific
content: I feel like my Fire TV has just gained a second and third life. I was fairly happy with my Fire TV but for me there was one thing missing. I go to a Church that streams the services and I if I can't make it because of my disability I watch it on my iPad . Of course friends with Apple TV's always told me how easy it was to use AirPlay and whatever they were watching on their iPad they could see on their TV. I also watch the Pirelli World Challenge on live stream and get tired of watching it on my iPad. So yesterday I went on a Google hunt for a resolution to my problem. One of the top answers was AirPlay/DLNA Receiver (Pro). So I checked it out in the App Store and I used my coins I never use to pay for the purchase. What a simple set up, even for this amateur , and thankfully the instructions come up right in the middle of the screen . I was set up and watching video on my TV in less than 5 minutes. This really is a MUST BUY for any Fire TV owner. I am all excited for the time I am going to get watching videos etc on my big screen in the future. I wish I had searched for this earlier. Last night when I was setting up I actually first connected and mirrored from my iPhone 6 and to see that 4" screen on a 42" monitor was just sweet. I also must say I don't understand where do many one star reviews came from and all the recent ones are the more deserving 5 star variety, I only can surmise that an earlier version must have been buggy. If you have a PC , iMac . Galaxy S6, iPhone or iPad this app is for you. It just works with everything and best of all it just works !!

title: ... little nervous about this purchase because the reviews are pretty erratic, but I have experienced no issues
content: I was a little nervous about this purchase because the reviews are pretty erratic, but I have experienced no issues. The installation was painless, my FireTV showed up in AirPlay right away and both picture and sound streamed well. This runs in the background, so it is always available. I have tested this with a MacBook Air, and iPhone 6 and an iPad Mini, seems to work with all of them. The only drawback I can see is that there does not seem to be a way to enable an onscreen security code or otherwise prevent unauthorized use, so presumably, anyone in range could grab the screen (either accidentally or maliciously). Not a big deal at my house, but could be a problem in apartments or public gatherings.

I've been mirroring my iPad while playing games, streaming YouTube videos, and even FaceTiming and the audio and video quality is perfect.  No lagging, sticking, out of sync or anything.  My iPad used about 5% of battery while streaming for an hour, which is great too!  I'm so glad I can get rid of my HDMI cable that I used to use to mirror my iPad to my 55" TV since now I can just use this app.  I have to admit that I was hesitant that this app would work based on other users reviews, but it works perfectly for me.

author: Christopher D. Boyd
title: the DLNA/uPNP features (as for use as media server) work pretty good, however since the AirPlay functionality is not ...
content: Utilizes a GNU/GPL wrapper/socket to invoke the AirPlay backend over DLNA/uPNP... the DLNA/uPNP features (as for use as media server) work pretty good, however since the AirPlay functionality is not truly using the Apple implementation (proprietary UDP socket method written in objective-C & implemented in cocoa/xCode API which does rely on some open socket features of the TCP/IP-UDP, and Physical-MAC stack (OSI model), the rendering model and display matrix is designed specifically for integrating with (streaming to) a rich client interface which is running on a iOS/Cocoa API (& ARM IA64 architecture) backend, and the mode that is utilized when this is not available is not the true Apple AirPlay mode, but a similar functionality of multicasting displays using NAT/broadcast, and therefore the stream incurs  tremendous latency. So be prepared for significant lag and a low frame rate/screen redraw. This is good to cast static or stable images such as a simple presentation or map, however if you intend on using it to cast HD video (local or streaming) from your idevice to your HDTV, then I would highly recommend you instead purchase a Lightning HDMI Digital Video Adapter, which will video mirror your iDevice in full hi-res 1080p with absolutely no lag/latency. This is what I use to display video content.

There is an option to adjust the timing but it doesn't correct far enough. I'll still use it, but only when it's far enough away from the other speakers that you can't hear the difference. Tried throwing video at it once. Was very choppy and didn't seem like it streamed fast enough. Will require further testing.

author: HP
title: works, but not really great for FireStick
content: It installed flawlesslessy on my firestick - it was automatic.  The GUI really needs some work - it's all list based, there is no border so the top row is at the very top of my screen, and the bottom row is at the very bottom.  It was a little non-intuitive, but I figured out how to get to the DLNA function that would let it stream from my WD MyCloud NAS.  It was very choppy, but I don't believe it's the app's fault.  The firestick just doesn't do a good job streaming DLNA.  I've tested streaming from WD MyCloud on my iPhone 5s, IPad Air 2 and Surface Pro3.  Video is smooth for all of those at nearly the same distance from my router.  So it's not my network or my WD MyCloud.  I don't think the FireStick is powerful enough to stream.  I also tried the AirPlay feature and it didn't work very well - it was choppy too and paused a lot to buffer.  But the app works as advertised.  It easily joined my network with the firestick and found my library of files from my NAS flawlessly.  So I can't really ding the app, other than to say the GUI could be improved.

author: KermitTheFrog
title: A much better app is available for less!
content: Please don't waste your money on this product!!  I was not able to get it to work after trying for several minutes with my iPhone and my new Amazon FireTV.  My goal was to get my iTunes to play on Amazon TV and my personal videos to play as well. If there is a way to get anything to work with AirPlay/DLNA it is not at all obvious and it shouldn't be this hard.  There is a cheaper and easier amazon app available which I highly recommend . The better app is "AirPlay&UPnP" which also shows up as "AirReceiver" which cost me $3.20 after taxes.  "AirPlay&UPnP" will do everything you want except play videos you bought through iTunes.  It actually completely mirrors your iPhone which is really cool and more than I was expecting.  Don't take my word for it, watch the following video on YouTube. It worked for me exactly as the youtube video shows. Get this amazon tv app instead! :  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hjz-o7oLp4Y

Other players like the one built into my BluRay or the Roku play these DLNA streams perfectly. The interface is clunky and does not resume or remember what was played.

title: Doesn't work with broadcast dlna service on network
content: Doesn't work with a DLNA server on Fedora Linux.  The Sony SMP N100/N200, and Sony Google TV on my network do see the DLNA server and stream quite well from it. AFAICT, this app does not scan the network for broadcast DLNA. The information I found on the Internet isn't clear, but it seems like this only works with a phone or tablet that are running as a dlna server and you have to "fling" the file from that device to the app on the firestick? I'm not sure though and am quite willing to change my review if anyone can point out how to get it working with a PC or Linux system running an actual broadcast dlna service.

I have had frequency drop of signal when streaming.  The device streams well when working up t HD TV signal close to 720p.  However, I have had series of drop connections to the FireTV. author: A. J.
title: Not perfect, but worth the small pricetag
content: I wanted more content on my Fire TV Stick because I have an iPad mini and can't afford Prime. After researching HDMI adapters, etc., I came across this program and, after reading the reviews, thought I'd try it. It can be a bit skippy and doesn't mirror absolutely everything but, with a little fiddling, I can watch most things on my TV that I normally view on my iPad. Two tips that weren't immediately apparent: 1) the iPad mirroring control is in the swipe-up menu at the bottom of the screen next to the AirDrop option; and 2) sites such as tvids.net work but they're persnickety. The program hangs and then says the software can't read their format if I try to watch it full-screen, but it works if I start it on the small screen and then double-tap it to enlarge partway. If (when) it freezes or I want to rewind, I double-tap again to reduce the screen size before trying to adjust anything. Overall, I think it's a good choice.

I tried to email the address in the description for a refund/return but the email bounced. It's a negligible amount of money but it would have been nice to know that there are limitations from a hardware perspective and those warnings were nonexistent.

author: CaddyH
title: Now I can see my IPad Screen on my Big TV!
content: Using my Amazon Fire Stick with this program installed, I can view my IPad screen on a 60" TV screen.  I use it to share pictures and Facebook posts with my husband and we also watch shows from streaming services on networks (PBS, TNT, ABC,etc.) that I have installed on my IPad. It really gives easy access to programs on demand.  The sound comes through the TV and I can control play with my IPad.  I really like this app!

author: Peter
title: Worth the Download
content: I enjoy the Amazon Fire TV products (I have both the box and the stick) but otherwise, I am an Apple user with Apple laptops, routers, and phones. That being said, I am happy that most (if not all) of the non-Apple streaming devices can "Airplay" or mirror the iPhone/iPad screen. This app does just that and does it well. It runs in the background as soon as you start up your Amazon Fire device and you don't notice it. But from your phone, you can "Airplay" anything on your screen to your TV at a moment's notice. I especially like that this app will mirror your device while you are in the middle of watching something or doing something else with the Amazon Fire device. It automatically overrides what you're watching and gives priority to the "Airplaying." Some context: we'll be watching Sling on our TV and I'll remember a funny Facebook or Youtube video that I want to show my wife. My son, with his never-ending curiosity, wants to watch too. So instead of playing the video multiple times and passing around my phone, I'll just cue it up, shoot it to the TV, and everyone can watch.

author: B. Flanagan
title: Buyer beware!
content: I bought this app to be able to stream Amazon purchased movies and shows from an iPad to a TV hooked up to a Fire Stick we brought with us on vacation. I was able to connect, but the developer failed to make clear that it will not stream any copyright protected content, whether you own it or not. So the only thing you can stream would be things like YouTube, which you can get outside the country on the Fire, unlike Amazon Video or Netflix. So for the things that it could do, I didn't need the app, and the app couldn't deliver the things I needed it for.

author: RG0647
title: Works perfectly with Apple AirPlay
content: I no longer use Apple TV since it is inferior to Fire TV.  I needed an app on Fire TV that would work with an IPad AirPlay.  Bought this app, downloaded it to a "Stick".  Checked the app settings, didn't need to do a thing.  Basically turned the app on.  Went to the IPad AirPlay, selected the Fire TV Stick and it worked the same as AirPlay on Apple TV.  Could not have been any easier to set up and use.

author: Scott
title: Won't stream DRM media
content: I wanted to stream iTunes movies from my iPhone to my Firestick.  I knew there had to be an app that would do this so of course I started looking at all the free apps first.  I tried a few and none of them worked (no big surprise I guess).

author: Athena Sanders
title: Stream from IPAD MINI 4 to my Firestick (Install on Firestick)
content: I bought it under my husband's account. Works great...quality of video great.. I am so happy I found this...I wanted to stream a movie from my ipad mini 4 to my husband's fire stick and works...thank you...I saw the star rating and was kinda worried but I had no issues.  It's a great app. Easy set up...because nothing you have to change all I changed was the name of the device.  Again I installed this app to the firestick and once that was done I was done. Then I just pressed my on my ipad mini 4 either the "air play" or "air mirror." That was all and I am so very happy.  I'm glad I selected this app it came down to 2 this one of course and reflector 2 at $6.99 or this one at $2.99.  I didn't download the other one so I can't say if that was just as good or not.  At the time of this review searching for the top app was the other one but this one should be up there as well.

author: Jeromatherapy
title: Seamless integration
content: Thought there would be more to getting Airfoil to play on my FireTV but once the app was installed everything took right off... a minor bit of latency in the playback from my MacBook Pro but they are so far removed there's no flutter. I can now happily trash my Apple TV. Any buyers?

author: T. Higgins
title: It also has very good video player that pauses/play/stop and rewind/forward on the bar ...
content: Work as described. It also has very good video player that pauses/play/stop and rewind/forward on the bar within the player. You can also use Air Play without mirroring being on, freeing up your iphone or ipad for other apps! pretty cool!

author: D. Snedigar
title: Just WORKS as advertised with MacBook Pro!
content: I JUST bought this not a few minutes ago, installed remotely to my Fire TV Stick, and INSTANTLY, I was able to mirror my MacBook Pro's screen to my FTV Stick on my 47" LED TV without any trouble with setup or settings. All I had to do was select it from the Airplay menu and BOOM - it was on my screen! There was a little lag with some things - but not bad at all. Which makes this app WORK AS ADVERTISED!

author: TrapJohn
title: Tried it - don't like it
content: Even tho I'm a techy (CS degree and years of R&D experience), can't seem to get this to reliably stream AirPlay.  Gave up on trying as I want "... the destination, not get mired down in the journey" of getting this to work.

author: John C.
title: It works!!
content: I was surprised when I found that this app actually worked.

author: P. Kennedy
title: Pretty good
content: Worked well with my iPhone 7 and daughters iPad for CBS all access and PBS masterpiece theater.  Did not work for Netflix or Amazon video (it may be because they were in Firetv and we have subscriptions already that were logged in on the firetv).  Worth the $5

author: Patrick Finger
title: Neat
content: It does screen mirroring for my iPhone. It will do audio separately. If you try both, it dies. It will not even screen mirror iPad, but will do audio. Pleased with it not even being a normal function of the device.

author: Danny Onate
title: Does not work with Mac

author: Kenneth P Valentine
title: IPhone AirPlay to Fire TV
content: Using an iPhone 6 with iOS 8 I was able to stream video with no glitches, drop outs or stutters for over an hour from our church service. Better quality than when using MacBook with hdmi cable. I also streamed video successfully from Vimeo on the iPhone very smoothly.  Audio equally smooth. Both times with video used mirroring. I was a little leary of the video after reading some reviews. My experience was flawless from setup to operation. My AirPort Extreme wireless router is in a second floor bedroom and my viewing room is in the first floor living room. My download speed is 20 mbs.

author: Inder S.
title: Best app for enabling airplay on Amazon firestick
content: The Best app to enable airplay , i tried almost everything this cuts down the task and a a very good price , good investment Thanky

title: Its ok

I find that it shuts itself and starts over quite often which causes you to have to tell your iPhone to send the video to the Firestick again every time that happens. When that isnt happening it is perfect screen mirroring from the iPhone to the Firestick.

author: mb8873

This app allows me to easily connect not only videos and photos already on my iPhone 6 plus but also ones I have stored in my Google Drive and Dropbox folders. It pretty much mirrors whatever is on my iPhone at the moment, even rotating the screen as I rotate the phone.

I'm watching sports my iphone on the firetv now.  It's the same quality as my apple tv.  No clue why people are saying otherwise.  Buy it! Works and you won't be disappointed.  Purchased this today 8/17.2016.

title: which I love. I have an Apple TV in my classroom ...
content: Works as advertised.  I can cast whatever is on my iPhone 6 screen to my TV using my Fire Stick. I wasn't sure at first. I attempted to cast, but it didn't work. I couldn't figure out what I did wrong. I watched the video and still no go. I put down my phone and walked away. Came back later and my phone's homescreen was casting. All I could do was laugh. So far a week later and it's still working, without an Apple TV, which I love. I have an Apple TV in my classroom at work and other than pairing my iPad to my projector it's totally useless. Glad I didn't spend 99 bucks on that useless streaming device. Looking forward to purchasing a Fire TV for my living room TV

title: Video mirroring doesn't work, it lags waaay behind the ...
content: Video mirroring doesn't work, it lags waaay behind the audio and then just cuts out after a few seconds. I have a top-of-the-line 802.11ac router, 100 Mbps connection, and a current generation MacBook Air, so the equipment is definitely not the problem.

author: Ryan C Behan
title: Works well unless you push hi-def video to FireTV
content: Reviewing for my experience on a FireTV and iOS 9.  This app works well for iOS local video, pictures and works well.  However, trying to push quality video via airplay from an app like Netflix, Syfy Now or others natively from the phone like you would for AppleTV fails with encoder failure errors.  I have played around with the settings but no luck getting that to work.

author: Abut
title: Needs some work
content: Plays video but lip sync out so not worth watching. Doesn't stream downloaded prime content from iPhone to firestick which is the least I would have exprcted. Update. Found that if external player like VLC selected in settings then streams MP4 files ok. So upgraded to 2 stars. If it streamed downloaded content from Amazon prime then would be worth 4 stars.

author: Terry L. Pepple
title: Love this app!
content: Love this app! Streaming from my Macbook Pro to my Fire Stick (gen 1) over a 5G home network. Able to use my HDTV as mirror and secondary display. Using Quicktime player, I can watch full 1080p movies in full screen without any noticble latency or buffering. Definitely worth the $4.99.

author: Morty
title: I want a refund
content: If they could fix the lag this app would be awesome, unfortunately the pictures about a half second behind the sound which makes watching anything ridiculous. If they could fix this I would give it a better rating.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Works. Barely..
content: After I downloaded it I synced it through my Fire TV Stick under Accounts then boom! There it is sitting as one of the available apps. I ran through the settings and started it up. A sec later I open my iphone 6s and I found FireTV as one of the available options in Airplay! It syncs right up and there was no lag whatsoever as I browsed through ebay, amazon, yelp various apps until I tried to pull up youtube.. It lags a sec of so but it was enough for me to quit the app and re-do my settings. I set the latency to 100 ms and rebooted the app. No luck. But when I pull up the youtube app on fire stick and open youtube app on my iphone and "broadcast" it internally without the this app. No lag, 0! Runs flawlessly. If you mirror from within youtube it will work but this app for use for normal screen mirroring for videos in facebook, instagram im not sure if it will do the trick.
